## News Review for hcltech

# HCLTech News Review

## Executive Summary

HCLTech demonstrated strong strategic positioning during this period through multiple high-profile partnerships and market share gains, despite facing industry-wide growth headwinds. The company gained 9 basis points in year-over-year market share in Q2FY26 while most Indian IT peers lost ground ([source](https://www.thehindubusinessline.com/info-tech/sequential-market-share-gains-mask-deeper-yearly-slide-for-indian-it/article70349573.ece)), and expanded its AI capabilities through strategic partnerships including a physical AI innovation lab with Nvidia in Silicon Valley ([source](https://www.verdict.co.uk/frontline-ai-the-deskless-ai-transformation-is-next/)) and multiple collaborations with AWS for financial services modernization ([source](https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/markets/stocks/news/hcltech-shares-in-focus-on-strategic-collaboration-agreement-with-aws/articleshow/125578881.cms)). However, the company reported revenue of $13.84 billion with growth slowing to 4.3% amid automation-driven challenges affecting the broader Indian IT sector ([source](https://www.livemint.com/companies/indian-it-revenue-growth-cautious-outlook-tech-spend-automation-ai-11764561142575.html)). HCLTech pursued inorganic growth through acquisitions including the $15.6 million purchase of Nuance ([source](https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/tech/information-tech/it-large-caps-back-on-acquisition-track-to-boost-skills-footprint/articleshow/125623462.cms)) and expanded its partnership ecosystem with SAP for physical AI solutions ([source](https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/tech/information-tech/hcltech-sap-expand-partnership-to-advance-real-world-physical-ai-solutions/articleshow/125584848.cms)), positioning itself as a leader in emerging technologies while maintaining market share in a challenging environment.

## Key Developments

**Strategic Partnerships**: HCLTech launched a physical AI innovation lab with Nvidia in Santa Clara, California on November 17, focusing on industrial AI applications for manufacturing, logistics, energy, and mining ([source](https://www.verdict.co.uk/frontline-ai-the-deskless-ai-transformation-is-next/)). The company also announced strategic collaborations with AWS for financial services modernization, delivering pre-built industry-compliant solutions for Banking, Wealth, and Insurance sectors ([source](https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/markets/stocks/news/hcltech-shares-in-focus-on-strategic-collaboration-agreement-with-aws/articleshow/125578881.cms)). Additionally, HCLTech expanded its partnership with SAP to develop Physical AI solutions for warehouse operations automation and fleet management ([source](https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/tech/information-tech/hcltech-sap-expand-partnership-to-advance-real-world-physical-ai-solutions/articleshow/125584848.cms)).

**Acquisitions**: The company acquired Nuance for $15.6 million as part of accelerated acquisition activity, participating in seven total acquisitions across the Indian IT sector in 2025 ([source](https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/tech/information-tech/it-large-caps-back-on-acquisition-track-to-boost-skills-footprint/articleshow/125623462.cms)).

**Financial Performance**: HCLTech reported revenue of $13.84 billion with 4.3% growth, down from 7-12% growth in FY23, reflecting industry-wide challenges from automation and shifting client spending patterns ([source](https://www.livemint.com/companies/indian-it-revenue-growth-cautious-outlook-tech-spend-automation-ai-11764561142575.html)).

**Market Recognition**: The company won the CX Distinguished Digital Resilience Award at Cisco's APJC 2025 customer awards, achieving 200% increase in analyzed flows and 100% segmentation compliance ([source](https://blogs.cisco.com/insidervoices/celebrating-excellence-cisco-customer-achievement-awards-apjc-2025-winners-announced)).

## Market Context

HCLTech's developments occur within a rapidly evolving technology landscape where the industrial AI market is projected to grow from $20.02 billion in 2024 to $90.28 billion by 2033 at an 18.6% CAGR ([source](https://www.verdict.co.uk/frontline-ai-the-deskless-ai-transformation-is-next/)). The company is positioned in the edge integration services market expected to reach $6.4 billion by 2030 with 20.9% CAGR ([source](https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2025/11/21/3192855/28124/en/Edge-Integration-Services-Market-Report-2025-Service-Types-Deployment-Types-Company-Types-and-Industry-Sectors.html)) and the IoT services market projected to grow from $304.1 billion in 2024 to $551.3 billion by 2030 ([source](https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2025/11/26/3195305/28124/en/Internet-of-Things-IoT-Services-Market-Trends-and-Investment-Opportunities-to-2030-Featuring-Profiles-of-15-Players-Strategic-Advisory-IoT-Services-Segment-Expands-Rapidly-at-11-4-.html)). The broader Indian IT sector faces challenges from automation reducing billable hours and clients shifting spending toward AI infrastructure, with the sector expected to grow toward $350-400 billion by 2030 ([source](https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/markets/expert-view/gst-relief-yet-to-translate-into-consumption-boost-warns-dhananjay-sinha/articleshow/125542341.cms)).

## Notable Quotes

**Vijay Guntur, CTO and Head of Ecosystems at HCLTech**: "The rapid advancement of AI platforms, combined with the increased availability of powerful simulation, robotics, and edge-compute technologies, means enterprises are finally able to bridge the gap between digital models and real-world deployment" ([source](https://www.verdict.co.uk/frontline-ai-the-deskless-ai-transformation-is-next/)).

**Srinivasan Seshadri, Chief Growth Officer and Global Head of Financial Services at HCLTech**: "We understand that a digital journey is of strategic importance and the need of the hour is for a trusted partner that can engage across the transformation lifecycle. Financial institutions face increasing pressure to modernize their systems, deliver exceptional customer experiences, and meet sustainability requirements and many struggle with legacy infrastructure, siloed data, and complex regulatory requirements" ([source](https://financialpost.com/pmn/business-wire-news-releases-pmn/hcltech-signs-strategic-collaboration-agreement-with-aws-to-accelerate-financial-services-industry-transformation-with-ai-and-core-modernization)).

**Heather Domin, Vice-President and Head of Office of Responsible AI and Governance, HCLTech**: "Collaboration is key to putting Responsible AI into practice. Working with Disseqt AI, we're enabling an ecosystem that empowers enterprises to innovate with speed and operationalize AI ethics, governance, and compliance at scale" ([source](https://www.finextra.com/pressarticle/108093/disseqt-ai-hcltech-and-microsoft-for-agentic-finance)).

## Strategic Implications

HCLTech's strategic positioning demonstrates a clear pivot toward emerging technologies and AI-driven solutions while maintaining competitive advantages in traditional IT services. The company's market share gains during an industry downturn indicate effective execution and client retention strategies. The multiple AI partnerships with Nvidia, AWS, SAP, and Microsoft position HCLTech to capitalize on the industrial AI market growth and financial services modernization trends. The expansion of sales and support teams by 1.5% while competitors reduced headcount suggests confidence in market recovery and potential for capturing additional market share ([source](https://www.thehindubusinessline.com/info-tech/indian-it-majors-see-reduction-in-sales-and-support-teams/article70331207.

### Article 1: Sequential market share gains mask deeper yearly slide for Indian IT

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://www.thehindubusinessline.com/info-tech/sequential-market-share-gains-mask-deeper-yearly-slide-for-indian-it/article70349573.ece)

## Summary

HCLTech emerged as one of the few Indian IT services firms to gain market share in Q2FY26, posting a 9 basis points year-over-year increase while most of its Indian peers lost ground to global competitors like Accenture and EPAM. The company also gained 11 basis points quarter-over-quarter in the Americas region, outperforming larger rivals including TCS which lost 65 basis points annually. This performance positions HCLTech favorably in a market where transformation budgets and GenAI deals are increasingly moving toward firms that demonstrate strong execution capabilities and client trust.

### Article 2: Frontline AI: The deskless AI transformation is next

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://www.verdict.co.uk/frontline-ai-the-deskless-ai-transformation-is-next/)

## Summary

HCLTech launched a physical AI innovation lab with Nvidia in Silicon Valley on November 17, positioning itself in the industrial AI market projected to grow from $20.02bn in 2024 to $90.28bn by 2033. The Santa Clara facility integrates with HCLTech's global AI Lab network and combines Nvidia's technology stack with HCLTech's physical AI solutions to help enterprises deploy autonomous systems for manufacturing, logistics, energy, and mining applications. CTO Vijay Guntur cited the convergence of mature AI hardware/software stacks and growing enterprise confidence as drivers for the timing of this partnership, which enables customers to bridge digital models with real-world deployment for preventative maintenance, predictive failure analysis, and automated anomaly detection.

## Executive Insights

**Vijay Guntur, CTO and head of ecosystems at HCLTech**

> "The rapid advancement of AI platforms, combined with the increased availability of powerful simulation, robotics, and edge-compute technologies, means enterprises are finally able to bridge the gap between digital models and real-world deployment."

*Context: Discussing the current state of industrial AI deployment and market readiness*

*Significance: Establishes HCLTech's view that the market has reached a critical juncture for industrial AI adoption*

**Vijay Guntur, CTO and head of ecosystems at HCLTech**

> "The convergence of mature AI hardware/software stacks, the pressing need for smarter and more sustainable operations, and growing enterprise confidence in digital transformation are all driving the wider take-off of physical right now."

*Context: Explaining the timing of HCLTech's Nvidia partnership and industrial AI focus*

*Significance: Positions the partnership as strategically timed to capitalize on market convergence factors*

### Article 3: India's IT growth trails global clients amid shift in tech spending; experts urge caution

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://www.livemint.com/companies/indian-it-revenue-growth-cautious-outlook-tech-spend-automation-ai-11764561142575.html)

## Summary

HCL Technologies reported $13.84 billion in revenue with 4.3% growth, reflecting an industry-wide slowdown affecting India's top five IT services companies since 2023. The company faces challenges from automation reducing billable hours, clients shifting spending toward AI infrastructure and global capacity centers, and the transition from people-based to outcome-based pricing models. HCLTech's growth now trails that of its global client base represented by S&P 500 and Stoxx 600 companies, indicating a structural shift in how multinational corporations allocate their technology budgets away from traditional IT outsourcing.

### Article 6: IT large caps back on acquisition track to boost skills, footprint

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/tech/information-tech/it-large-caps-back-on-acquisition-track-to-boost-skills-footprint/articleshow/125623462.cms)

## Summary

HCLTech acquired Nuance for $15.6 million in 2025 as part of an industry-wide acceleration in acquisition activity among major Indian IT services companies, which collectively completed seven acquisitions in 2025 compared to just two in 2023. The acquisition reflects a broader strategic shift toward smaller, capability-driven tuck-in deals rather than large-scale acquisitions, with HCLTech historically being among the most aggressive acquirers in the sector having completed four acquisitions in 2022. This activity occurs amid improved macroeconomic conditions that make asset acquisition more viable, with the industry focusing on immediate-impact acquisitions rather than long-term bets on emerging technologies.

### Article 7: Indian IT majors see reduction in sales and support teams

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://www.thehindubusinessline.com/info-tech/indian-it-majors-see-reduction-in-sales-and-support-teams/article70331207.ece)

## Summary

HCLTech increased its sales and support headcount by 1.5% in Q2 FY26, making it one of only two major Indian IT firms to expand these teams while competitors TCS, Wipro, and Tech Mahindra reduced staff by 3-8% due to margin pressures and AI automation adoption. This counter-trend positioning suggests HCLTech either maintains confidence in market recovery or follows a different timeline for implementing AI-driven automation in sales and support functions, potentially creating competitive advantages through maintained market coverage while peers reduce their sales capacity.

### Article 19: Edge Integration Services Market Report 2025: Service Types, Deployment Types, Company Types and Industry Sectors

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2025/11/21/3192855/28124/en/Edge-Integration-Services-Market-Report-2025-Service-Types-Deployment-Types-Company-Types-and-Industry-Sectors.html)

## Summary

HCLTech has been identified as one of the dominant players in the edge integration services market, which is projected to grow from $2.1 billion in 2024 to $6.4 billion by 2030 at a 20.9% CAGR. The company competes alongside major consulting firms like Accenture, IBM Consulting, and Capgemini, as well as specialized providers, in delivering edge-specific services driven by 5G adoption, industrial IoT expansion, and hybrid cloud-edge deployments. The market is characterized by demand from industrial manufacturing for deterministic performance and rapid growth in IT & telecom sectors through multi-access edge computing rollouts, presenting HCLTech with opportunities across multiple industry verticals in containerized edge deployments and AI inference capabilities.
